reviews.positive_text: The hotel was perfectly central to the train/bus station.   My room was like the pictures on the website site.  The bed was comfy and big for a solo traveller.  The staff were very helpful, supplying me with knowledge of the area and a map on how to get where I wanted to go.  I was also able to leave my bag when I checked out meaning I could walk around until I left unencumbered by a heaving backpack.  I was also able to sit in the lobby/restaurant later on in the evening whilst I waited for my lift. The room was quiet at night even though it was central.
reviews.negative_text: It is situated along a street with shops/boulangeries etc so you have to go up several flights of stairs before reaching your room however there is a lift but I didn't use it.  Would be difficult for those with mobility issues or prams etc.  The only thing I'd change about the room is the shower could have done with a bit of an update as it had an old shower curtain which was stained/dirty along the bottom and didn't work too well with water leaking out on to the floor regularly as the curtain kept blowing into the shower.  Some cups for water would have been a nice touch.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable hotel in convenient location; maybe not for those with mobility concerns
reviews.positive_text: I very much enjoyed my stay here in a very comfortable and nicely-decorated room. The hotel was about a 1 minute walk from the train (helpful with my luggage!) and <10 minutes walk to the lake and old town areas. Shopping and restaurants surround the hotel. Staff were quite courteous and allowed me to store luggage outside of my check-in time. The room was clean and really comfortable and pleasant to be in after a day of vigorous exercise.
reviews.negative_text:
Although not a problem for me, I would advise caution to anyone with mobility challenges before staying here. The room and bathroom size were comfortable to an average-sized person BUT there were a number of ledges and level changes inside the bathroom, which might be trip hazards. I actually liked the bathroom layout for myself, but others with mobility or vision challenges might feel very differently.

I was also surprised that there was no shelf inside the shower to place shampoo. Perhaps the concierge might have provided something if I had asked (to be clear, I did not try! my own fault). Otherwise the shower was beautiful with a rainshower-style showerhead and plenty of room. 

As mentioned by others, there is no elevator. Staff were willing to assist with luggage, though.
